titleStmt.title: R. K. Williams et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7488

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette

the undersigned R K Williams was the judge who presided at the trial and Conviction ofW. P. Clark for horse steeling in the McCracken circuit court, after he was released from the Penetientiary he prosecuted Wm Morse for stealing the same horse which resulted in his conviction for eight years, over six years of which has elapsed, he therefore joins in the petition with the several members of the legislature in asking that said Moore be pardoned,

R K Williams
G. W Carlisle
Jas P. Ford
Jas Wood
C R Craycroft
J W, Finnie
Richd Gregory
Lewis Myers
B. F. Cockrell
M. J. Williams
H. S. Wright
John H Reynolds
W R Bradley
C. T. Worthington
J,, W,, Ogilvie
W. T. Chiles
N. R. Black
J. N. Yardell
James Brien
Thos H Corbett
Jos, B. Woolfolk
J D Lillard
Wm Fishers
W G Connor
Theodore Thompson
Wm Beadles
J M Corbin
Wm Moore has been a well behaved man, and I think is intitled to Executive clemency

McCracken Cir Ct
vs
Wm Moore
8 years
Sentenced 1859
Pardoned 15 Dec 1865
